column4: I have installed ubuntu as wubi. Suddenly getting problem while loading - grub CLI comes and if i type boot it says no kernel found. How to resolve this? Thanks!!
Are you still able to boot Windows?
: Yes. I am able to
Do you have any important files in your Wubi install?
: If i can recover some files, that will also be good.
OK. Do you know where those files are within Ubuntu? It's pretty easy to backup the files from Wubi using an Ubuntu LiveCD/USB, and then I'd recommend doing a normal dual boot rather than using Wubi.
: Ya i know the location. Do i need to know the exact device detail like sda etc or just location like /home/username/Desktop ?
: I know the latter one only.
Just /home/username/Desktop/. More than that is needed to get at the files, but I can help you with everything else :)
: Cool. Its enough if i get just one folder :)
: Can i do like booting from USB Stick and try to get the device in which Ubuntu is installed and fetch the data?
Yes. If you can do it soon I can walk you through it (I'm planning to go to sleep soon).
: Have booted in USB
OK. Can you pastebin the output of "sudo blkid"?
: Just a sec. Right now in different maching. Will switch the internet to the ubuntu machine. be right back in 1 min.
: Thats the link!!
: 59GB partition is the one were ubuntu is installed
Those two outputs taken together seem impossible to me at the moment. I may be too tired to help.

The thing that is confusing me is that you have an msdos partition table with 4 primary partitions, yet you somehow *also* have partittions 5 and 6 on the same drive. Maybe I'll be able to help you tomorrow when I'm more awake.
: Sure, thanks !! :) Will check the loopmount and the wubildr method till then :) Thanks for your help !!
Does the directory /vdisk/ exist?
: I created one manually
